text.__SUMMARY__: Tropidophis wrighti, commonly known as the gracile banded dwarf boa or Wright's dwarf boa, is a species of snake in the family Tropidophiidae. The species is endemic to Cuba.
text.Etymology: T. wrighti is named after American botanist and explorer Charles Wright.
text.Geographic range: T. wrighti is found in eastern Cuba from Céspedes in Camagüey Province eastward to Santiago de Cuba in Santiago de Cuba Province.
text.Further reading: Stull OG (1928). "A Revision of the Genus Tropidophis ". Occ. Pap. Mus. Zool. Univ. Michigan (195): 1-49. (Tropidophis wrighti, new species, pp. 38–39).
